data: CARD Epinephrine and Procainamide Drug Challenge (Day of Treatment)
Discharge 90 minutes following discontinuation of final drug infusion and Electrocardiogram 12 Lead returns to baseline
Advance/Adjust to: Clear Fluid Diet, Start at midnight on day prior to procedure
Except for Medications.  Start 3 hours pre-procedure
order rate: 75 mL/h, IV, drug form: bag
5 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj
epinephrine titratable infusion (12 mcg/mL) in NS
titrate, IV, 0.03 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 0.2 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate as per instructions
2.5 mg, IV, q1min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
5 mg, IV, q1min, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
For management of extravasation of epinephrine please refer to your extravasation policy
5 mg, intradermal, once, other (see comment), drug form: inj
10 mg, intradermal, once, other (see comment), drug form: inj
Prior to procainamide challenge have isoproterenol 0.2 mg/mL amp ready at bedside
15 mg/kg, IV, once, administer over: 20 minute, drug form: inj
isoproterenol continuous infusion (4 mcg/mL) in NS
2 mcg/min, IV, order duration: 30 minute, drug form: bag
For women under 60 years of age
For patients transferred from other site
Nares (S. aureus only), Routine, Collection: T;N, once
Multiple Sites, Routine, Collection: T;N, once
